turns.speaker: HATTIE
turns.text: Is this your house?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Oh. I'm sorry. Gideon, what do you say?

turns.speaker: HATTIE
turns.text: In the meantime Harry can slaughter us a hog.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: I already have, my dear.

turns.speaker: JUNIOR
turns.text: I appreciate you lending me a hand. That lazy ass brother of mine was suppose to help me.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Well some folks are still waiting for their comeuppance. Don't take me wrong but you can't judge people by how you act. You're a caring person.

turns.speaker: JUNIOR
turns.text: He should be caring. That is not too much to ask.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Ya, but you can't do the shuffle with one leg. You and your wife, in your spare time, work with the less fortunate. Now I'm not talking about you and what you do but some folks that always run to help the victim, deep down are attracted to pain and suffering and love to be near the dying.

turns.speaker: JUNIOR
turns.text: All the people working with us are really doing it 'cause they hate to see suffering.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: You never know what's in the heart and just because you can cry doesn't make you human.

turns.speaker: LINDA
turns.text: You don't act like the rest of Gideon's friends. They believe if you are not hard at work, you are hard at sin.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Oh, I'm more modern in my ways. I don't believe in sin, though there is good and evil.  And evil is a thing you work at.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Not you mustn't touch. Your mama might not like you handling knives.

turns.speaker: LINDA
turns.text: I think he wants to see your rabbit foot.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: I let this rabbit foot do in place of my toby that I lost years ago.

turns.speaker: LINDA
turns.text: What's a toby?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: You don't want to be at crossroads without one. It's a charm that old people teach you how to make. I had one for a long time that belonged to my grandmother who had it ever since she was a child.  In my travels I misplaced it. I have been looking over my shoulder ever since.

turns.speaker: LINDA
turns.text: I thought you weren't old fashioned.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: In some things. When we were children, there used to be an old man that came around and would snatch your soul if you didn't have something on you that didn't make a X.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Did you have your child at home?

turns.speaker: LINDA
turns.text: No. No. No. No. I had my Child at Cedars and Sinai. And that ain't no county hospital. You have to have cash or check before you come in the door.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Some folks take that natural stuff too far.

turns.speaker: LINDA
turns.text: Junior's wife kept her afterbirth' in the refrigerator. That's why I do not eat over there now.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Country people got so many strange ways,

turns.speaker: SUZIE
turns.text: No, but I might have some Indian Chief Tonic.

turns.speaker: HATTIE
turns.text: I haven't heard anyone mention Swamp Root since button-up shoes went out.

turns.speaker: HATTIE
turns.text: You know Harry lied about how that boy Hocker got kilt. And it was Harry who saw Emory last before they found him hanging over a levee like someone would hang a hog.

turns.speaker: SUZIE
turns.text: I remember Harry always trying to help someone. He got Lulla's daughter out of trouble. He was always running to the store for someone who couldn't leave the house.

turns.speaker: HATTIE
turns.text: Harry always shows his good side and, like the moon, the other side is black. Back home he always did try to act like the colored gentleman. I'm telling you Harry is nothing but evil. I'm warning you -- you can't keep a wild animal as a pet around children.

turns.speaker: SUZIE
turns.text: You know Okra asked me to marry him the other evening.

turns.speaker: HATTIE
turns.text: Rush your mouth, girl. No, he didn't. He cannot be that big of a damn fool.

turns.speaker: SUZIE
turns.text: I asked Harry about it. He didn't own up to it. He said he didn't know what got into Okra.

turns.speaker: HATTIE
turns.text: He's just raffish. Harry put him up to it. Before evening sun sets, I would have his belongings back on Route 55, that old fox.

turns.speaker: SUZIE
turns.text: I can't accuse him just dry long 80.

turns.speaker: HATTIE
turns.text: Everybody who have been associated with Harry end up with pennies over their eyes.

turns.speaker: SUZIE
turns.text: What must I do?

turns.speaker: HATTIE
turns.text: If it was left up to me, I would poison him.

turns.speaker: JUNIOR
turns.text: We can't really bring another family in here with us.

turns.speaker: PAT
turns.text: Why not? Harry says that's the only way to do good.

turns.speaker: JUNIOR
turns.text: When did you talk to Harry?

turns.speaker: PAT
turns.text: Don't shout!

turns.speaker: PAT
turns.text: He just leeches off your parents. He is a master at wearing out welcome.

turns.speaker: JUNIOR
turns.text: Harry is the kind of guy you would love to take out in the woods and leave under a rock.

turns.speaker: PAT
turns.text: Where does her get the power to summon all his old raffish friends? They all smell of moth balls.

turns.speaker: PAT
turns.text: Now you don't have to say anything if you don't want to.

turns.speaker: JUNIOR
turns.text: I want to hear what happened. My brother is a jackass and a damn fool. The both of you have been as scarce as hen's teeth.

turns.speaker: PAT
turns.text: You shouldn't talk about the boy's father in front of him. This is family business and we have to pull together.

turns.speaker: JUNIOR
turns.text: Whether the boy hears it or not, the man is still a jackass. Everyone should have some mother wit.

turns.speaker: MR. BAKER
turns.text: What are you doing?

turns.speaker: MRS. BAKER
turns.text: Counting the gray hairs in your head.

turns.speaker: MR. BAKER
turns.text: Counting the what? What does that have to do with the price of butter?

turns.speaker: MRS. BAKER
turns.text: I was just trying to make conversation.

turns.speaker: MR. BAKER
turns.text: Where is Skip?

turns.speaker: MRS. BAKER
turns.text: He is in his pigeon cage.

turns.speaker: MR. BAKER
turns.text: I'm sorry he got those birds.

turns.speaker: MRS. BAKER
turns.text: You know the man next door is near death.

turns.speaker: SUZIE
turns.text: How are you?

turns.speaker: OLD JOHN
turns.text: Tolerably well. I brought you some more rabbit manure for your roses.

turns.speaker: SUZIE
turns.text: It is so considerate of you.

turns.speaker: OLD JOHN
turns.text: I didn't mean for you to pay me for that.

turns.speaker: SUZIE
turns.text: I know you didn't but you have been so thoughtful.

turns.speaker: OLD JOHN
turns.text: But when your sunflowers come up, I'll pay you for them.

turns.speaker: SUZIE
turns.text: I planted a row just for you and you don't owe me anything.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Wow!  Cool!

turns.speaker: MRS. DAVIS
turns.text: Whadda ya think?

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Oh, this looks GREAT, Mom!

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Can we leave this up 'til we move?

turns.speaker: MRS. DAVIS
turns.text: Well, sure, we can leave it up.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Yeah!

turns.speaker: MRS. DAVIS
turns.text: Now go get Molly.  Your friends are going to be here any minute.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: MRS. DAVIS
turns.text: Come on down, guys.  It's time for games!  We've got prizes!

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Oh, yeah!

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: To infinity and beyond!

turns.speaker: MRS. DAVIS
turns.text: Oh, all this packing makes me hungry.  What would you say to dinner at, uh, oh, Pizza Planet?

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Pizza Planet?!  Oh, cool!

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Can I bring some toys?

turns.speaker: MRS. DAVIS
turns.text: You can bring ONE toy...

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Just one?

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Mom!  Do you know where Buzz is?

turns.speaker: MRS. DAVIS
turns.text: No, I haven't seen him.

turns.speaker: MRS. DAVIS
turns.text: Andy!  I'm heading out the door.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: But Mom, I can't find him!

turns.speaker: MRS. DAVIS
turns.text: Well, honey, just grab some other toy!  Now c'mon!

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Okay...

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: I couldn't find my Buzz.  I know I left him right there.

turns.speaker: MRS. DAVIS
turns.text: Honey, I'm sure he's around. You'll find him.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Can I help pump the gas?

turns.speaker: MRS. DAVIS
turns.text: Sure!  I'll even let you drive.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Yeah?!

turns.speaker: MRS. DAVIS
turns.text: Yeah -- when you're sixteen.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Yuk, yuk, yuk -- funny, Mom.

turns.speaker: MRS. DAVIS
turns.text: Next stop...

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Pizza Planet!  Yeah!!!

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Mom, have you seen Woody?

turns.speaker: MRS. DAVIS
turns.text: Where was the last place you left him?

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Right here in the van.

turns.speaker: MRS. DAVIS
turns.text: Oh, I'm sure he's there.  You're just not looking hard enough.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: He's not here, Mom.  Woody's gone.

turns.speaker: MRS. DAVIS
turns.text: I looked everywhere, honey, but all I could find was your hat.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: But what if we leave them behind?

turns.speaker: MRS. DAVIS
turns.text: Oh, don't worry, honey, I'm sure we'll find Woody and Buzz before we leave tomorrow.

turns.speaker: MRS. DAVIS
turns.text: Everybody say, "Bye, house."

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Bye, house.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Hey!  Wow!

turns.speaker: MRS. DAVIS
turns.text: What?  What is it?

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Woody!  Buzz!

turns.speaker: MRS. DAVIS
turns.text: Oh, great, you found them.  Where were they?

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Here!  In the car!

turns.speaker: MRS. DAVIS
turns.text: See?  Now, what did I tell you? Right where you left them.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Which one can I open first?

turns.speaker: MRS. DAVIS
turns.text: Let's let Molly open one.

turns.speaker: WOODY
turns.text: Aach! -- Oh, hi, Bo.

turns.speaker: BO PEEP
turns.text: I wanted to thank you, Woody, for saving my flock.

turns.speaker: WOODY
turns.text: Oh, hey - it was nothing.

turns.speaker: BO PEEP
turns.text: Whadda ya say I get someone else to watch the sheep tonight?

turns.speaker: WOODY
turns.text: Heh, heh...oh yeah, uh, I...

turns.speaker: WOODY
turns.text: You'd think they've never seen a new toy before.

turns.speaker: BO PEEP
turns.text: Well sure, look at him.  He's got more gadgets on him then a Swiss army knife.

turns.speaker: WOODY
turns.text: Uh, let what?  I don't -- Uh, what do you mean?  Who?

turns.speaker: BO PEEP
turns.text: I know Andy's excited about Buzz, but you know, he'll always have a special place for you.

turns.speaker: BO PEEP
turns.text: What are you doing over there?

turns.speaker: WOODY
turns.text: It's a long story, Bo.  I'll explain later.  Here, catch this!

turns.speaker: WOODY
turns.text: We're almost there.

turns.speaker: BO PEEP
turns.text: Rocky!  The ramp!

turns.speaker: WOODY
turns.text: Whoooooah!  Oh!  Bo!  There's gotta be a less painful way to get my attention.

turns.speaker: BO PEEP
turns.text: Merry Christmas, Sheriff.

turns.speaker: WOODY
turns.text: Say, isn't that mistletoe?

turns.speaker: BO PEEP
turns.text: Mm-hmmmmm.

turns.speaker: WOODY
turns.text: Hello-o-o...

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: HO-YAAAHH!!!

turns.speaker: WOODY
turns.text: Yes, it is a mistake, because, you see, the bed, here, is my spot.

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: I need to repair my turbo boosters. Do you people still use fossil fuels, or have you discovered crystalic fusion?

turns.speaker: WOODY
turns.text: Well, let's see, we've got double A's --

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: Watch yourself!!

turns.speaker: WOODY
turns.text: Yes.  They're Andy's toys.

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: Alright, everyone.  You're clear to come up.

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: Toy?

turns.speaker: WOODY
turns.text: T-O-Y.  Toy.

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: Excuse me, I think the word you're searching for is Space Ranger.

turns.speaker: WOODY
turns.text: The word I'm searching for I can't say because there's pre-school toys present.

turns.speaker: WOODY
turns.text: He's not a Space Ranger!  He doesn't fight evil or shoot lasers or fly --

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: Excuse me.

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: They are a terillium-carbonic alloy and I CAN fly.

turns.speaker: WOODY
turns.text: No, you can't.

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: Yes, I can.

turns.speaker: WOODY
turns.text: You can't!

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: Can!

turns.speaker: WOODY
turns.text: Can't!  Can't!  Can't!

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: I tell you, I could fly around this room with my eyes closed!

turns.speaker: WOODY
turns.text: Okay then, Mr. Lightbeer!  Prove it.

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: All right, then, I will.  Stand back everyone!

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: Why, thank you.  Thank you all. Thank you.

turns.speaker: WOODY
turns.text: That wasn't flying!  That was falling with style!

turns.speaker: WOODY
turns.text: Listen, Lightsnack, you stay away from Andy.  He's mine, and no one is taking him away from me.

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: What are you talking about?  Where's that bonding strip?!

turns.speaker: WOODY
turns.text: And another thing.  Stop with this spaceman thing.  It's getting on my nerves.

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: Are you saying you want to lodge a complaint with Star Command? WOODY Oh okay, so you want to do it the hard way, huh?

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: Don't even think about it, cowboy!

turns.speaker: WOODY
turns.text: Oh, yeah, tough guy?!

turns.speaker: WOODY
turns.text: You actually think you're THE "Buzz Lightyear?" Oh, all this time I thought it was an act!  Hey, guys!  Look!  It's the REAL Buzz Lightyear!

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: You're mocking me, aren't you?

turns.speaker: WOODY
turns.text: Oh, no, no, no...  Buzz, look!  An alien!

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: Where?

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: What's going on?

turns.speaker: WOODY
turns.text: Nothing that concerns you spacemen. Just us TOYS.

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: I'd better take a look anyway.

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: Why is that soldier strapped to an explosive device?

turns.speaker: WOODY
turns.text: That's why.  Sid.

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: Sure is a hairy fellah.

turns.speaker: WOODY
turns.text: No!  No, that's Scud, you idiot!

turns.speaker: WOODY
turns.text: THAT is Sid!

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: You mean that happy child?

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: I could have stopped him.

turns.speaker: WOODY
turns.text: Buzz, I would love to see you try.  'Course I'd love to see you as a crater.

turns.speaker: WOODY
turns.text: Buzz!!  Oh, Buzz, Buzz Lightyear!! Buzz Lightyear, thank goodness! We've got trouble!

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: Trouble?!  Where?!

turns.speaker: WOODY
turns.text: Down there.  Just down there.  A helpless toy...it's...it's trapped, Buzz!

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: Then we've no time to lose!!

turns.speaker: WOODY
turns.text: Right?  Buddy?

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: I just want you to know that even though you tried to terminate me, revenge is not an idea we promote on my planet.

turns.speaker: WOODY
turns.text: Oh.  Oh, that's good.

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: But we're not on my planet, are we?

turns.speaker: WOODY
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: According to my nava-computer, the --

turns.speaker: WOODY
turns.text: Shut up!  Just shut up, you idiot!!

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: Sheriff, this is no time to panic.

turns.speaker: WOODY
turns.text: This is the perfect time to panic! I'm lost, Andy is gone, they're going to move from their house in two days and it's all your fault!!

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: My fault?!  If you hadn't pushed me out of the window in the first place --

turns.speaker: WOODY
turns.text: Oh, yeah?  Well, if YOU hadn't shown up in your stupid little cardboard spaceship and taken away everything that was important to me --

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: Don't talk to me about importance. Because of YOU the security of this entire universe is in jeopardy.

turns.speaker: WOODY
turns.text: WHAT?!!  What are you talking about?!

turns.speaker: WOODY
turns.text: Buzz!  Buzz, come back!

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: Go away.

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: Now you're sure this spacefreighter will return to its port of origin once it jettisons its food supply?

turns.speaker: WOODY
turns.text: Uh-huh.  And when we get there, we'll be able to find a way to transport you...home.

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: Well, then let's climb abroad.

turns.speaker: WOODY
turns.text: No, no, no, wait, Buzz, Buzz, let's get in the back.  No one will see us there.

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: Negative.  There are no restraining harnesses in the cargo area.  We'll be much safer in the cockpit.

turns.speaker: WOODY
turns.text: Ow!  Watch where you're going!

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: Sorry.

turns.speaker: WOODY
turns.text: Wait a minute!  No Buzz!  This way! There's a special ship.  I just saw it!

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: You mean it has hyperdrive?

turns.speaker: WOODY
turns.text: Hyper-active hyperdrive, and astro...uh, turf.

turns.speaker: WOODY
turns.text: C'mon, c'mon, that's it...

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: Where is it?  I don't see the --

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: Spaceship.

turns.speaker: WOODY
turns.text: Alright Buzz, get ready...

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: What's gotten into you, Sheriff?  I was --

turns.speaker: WOODY
turns.text: YOU are the one that decided to climb into this --

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: I've set my laser from stun to kill.

turns.speaker: WOODY
turns.text: Oh, great, great.  Yeah, and if anyone attacks us we can blink 'em to death.

turns.speaker: WOODY
turns.text: I sure hope this isn't permanent.

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: Still no word from Star Command. We're not that far from the spaceport --

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: Woody, we don't know what's out there!

turns.speaker: WOODY
turns.text: I'll tell you what's -- AAAAH!

turns.speaker: WOODY
turns.text: They're gonna eat us, Buzz!!  Do something!  Quick!

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: Shield your eyes!

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: It's not working.  I recharged it before I left.  It should be good for hours --

turns.speaker: WOODY
turns.text: Oh, you idiot!  You're a toy!  Use your karate chop action!

turns.speaker: WOODY
turns.text: Get away!  Hoo-cha!  Hoo-cha!

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: Hey!!  Hey!  How are you doing that? Stop that!

turns.speaker: WOODY
turns.text: Back!  Back, you savages!  Back!

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: Woody, stop it!!

turns.speaker: WOODY
turns.text: Sorry guys, but dinner's canceled!

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: Another stunt like that, cowboy -- you're going to get us killed.

turns.speaker: WOODY
turns.text: Don't tell me what to do!

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: Shhh!

turns.speaker: WOODY
turns.text: What happened to you?

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: One minute you're defending the whole galaxy...  ...and suddenly you find yourself suckin' down Darjeeling with Marie Antoinette and her little sisters.

turns.speaker: WOODY
turns.text: I think you've had enough tea for today.  Let's get you out of here, Buzz.

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: Don't you get it?!  You see the hat? I am Mrs. Nesbit!!

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: Oh, I'm a sham!!

turns.speaker: WOODY
turns.text: Sh-h-h-h-h!!  Quiet, Buzz.

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: Look at me!  I can't even fly out of a window!

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: But -- the hat looked good.  Tell me the hat looked good!  The apron is a bit much, it's not my color...

turns.speaker: WOODY
turns.text: Out the window...Buzz, you're a genius!

turns.speaker: WOODY
turns.text: Come on, this way!

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: Years of Academy training...wasted!!

turns.speaker: WOODY
turns.text: Oh, come on, Buzz.  I...Buzz, I can't do this without you.  I need your help.

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: I can't help.  I can't help anyone.

turns.speaker: WOODY
turns.text: Why, sure you can, Buzz.  You can get me out of here and then I'll get that rocket off you, and we'll make a break for Andy's house.

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: Andy's house.  Sid's house.  What's the difference.

turns.speaker: WOODY
turns.text: Oh, Buzz, you've had a big fall. You must not be thinking clearly.

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: No, Woody, for the first time I am thinking clearly.  You were right all along.  I'm not a Space Ranger.  I'm just a toy.  A stupid little insignificant toy.

turns.speaker: WOODY
turns.text: Whoa, hey -- wait a minute.  Being a toy is a lot better than being a Space Ranger.

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: Yeah, right.

turns.speaker: WOODY
turns.text: No, it is.  Look, over in that house is a kid who thinks you are the greatest, and it's not because you're a Space Ranger, pal, it's because you're a TOY!  You are HIS toy.

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: But why would Andy want me?

turns.speaker: WOODY
turns.text: Why would Andy want you?!  Look at you!  You're a Buzz Lightyear.  Any other toy would give up his moving parts just to be you.  You've got wings, you glow in the dark, you talk, your helmet does that -- that whoosh thing -- you are a COOL toy.

turns.speaker: WOODY
turns.text: Buzz!!  What are you doing?  I thought you were --

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: Come on, Sheriff.  There's a kid over in that house who needs us. Now let's get you out of this thing.

turns.speaker: WOODY
turns.text: Yes Sir!

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: Woody!  It's the moving van.

turns.speaker: WOODY
turns.text: We've got to get out of here...NOW.

turns.speaker: WOODY
turns.text: Shhhhhhh!

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: What?!

turns.speaker: WOODY
turns.text: It's ok.  Everything's under control.

turns.speaker: WOODY
turns.text: Nice work, fellahs.  Good job. Comin' out of the ground -- what a touch!  That was a stroke of genius.

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: Woody!

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: Hold on, Woody!

turns.speaker: WOODY
turns.text: I can't do it!  Take care of Andy for me!

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: NO-O-O-O-O-O-O!!

turns.speaker: WOODY
turns.text: Well, thanks for the ride.

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: Look out!!

turns.speaker: WOODY
turns.text: Great!

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: Woody!  The rocket!

turns.speaker: WOODY
turns.text: The match!

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: Woody?!  What are you doing?

turns.speaker: WOODY
turns.text: Hold still, Buzz!

turns.speaker: WOODY
turns.text: Ha-ha!!

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: You did it!  Next stop.  Andy.

turns.speaker: WOODY
turns.text: Ahhh!! This is the part where we blow up!

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: Not today!

turns.speaker: WOODY
turns.text: Hey, Buzz!!  You're flying!!

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: This isn't flying.  This is falling -- with style!

turns.speaker: WOODY
turns.text: Ha ha!!  To Infinity and Beyond!!

turns.speaker: WOODY
turns.text: Uh, Buzz?!  We missed the truck!

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: We're not aiming for the truck!

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: Me?  No, no, no, no...  Are you?

turns.speaker: WOODY
turns.text: Now Buzz, what could Andy possibly get that is worse than you?!

turns.speaker: WOODY
turns.text: It doesn't matter how much we're played with.  What matters is that we're here for Andy when he needs us.  That's what we're made for. Right? Everyone is now looking down, sheepish.

turns.speaker: HAMM
turns.text: Pardon me.  I hate to break up the staff meeting, but THEY'RE HERE! Birthday guests at three o'clock!

turns.speaker: WOODY
turns.text: Stay calm, everyone!!

turns.speaker: WOODY
turns.text: No, no!  Turn 'em around, turn 'em around!

turns.speaker: HAMM
turns.text: Eh, he's puttin' 'em in backwards!

turns.speaker: WOODY
turns.text: Plus is positive, minus is negative! Oh, let me!

turns.speaker: WOODY
turns.text: It's not a laser!  It's a little lightbulb that blinks!

turns.speaker: HAMM
turns.text: What's with him?

turns.speaker: HAMM
turns.text: Oh, impressive wingspan.  Very good!

turns.speaker: WOODY
turns.text: Oh, what?!...What?!  These are plastic.  He can't fly!

turns.speaker: WOODY
turns.text: Hi!

turns.speaker: HAMM
turns.text: Everyone, it's Woody!

turns.speaker: HAMM
turns.text: Something's screwy here.

turns.speaker: WOODY
turns.text: So, you see?  We're friends now, guys.  Aren't we, Buzz?  You bet.  Gimme a hug.

turns.speaker: HAMM
turns.text: Oh, boy.  Will ya take a look at all those presents?!

turns.speaker: MR. POTATO HEAD
turns.text: I can't see a thing!

turns.speaker: MR. POTATO HEAD
turns.text: Hey, watch it!

turns.speaker: HAMM
turns.text: Sorry there, old Spudhead.
